metadata.name: Life
metadata.description:
Humans experience life through their body (matter), their thoughts (electrical impulses), and intuitions (spiritual intuition comes from the emptiness of the mind). 
When we think about the Universe we live in, we imagine matter first, light and darkness, space and time. 
However, Matter and Light, as we know them,  are only responsible for 4% of the entire Universe's energy, most of the matter that obeys the gravitational forces is Dark Matter 23%. Everything else is Dark Energy 73% with the gravitational field permeating the entire Universe and the electromagnetic most of it.

The God Particle (Higgs Boson) plays an important role in our existence, our body, and our brain because it is responsible for the mechanism that gives particles mass.  
The first few seconds of this video (00:00 - 00:15) are a representation of the Higgs Boson through their Feynman diagrams (particle interactions that produce the God Particle as seen in particle accelerators). 
The mass assigned to particles through the Higgs Boson is subject to gravity and collapses under the gravitation forces (rotating and collapsing matter)
The green waves of energy (00:16 - 00:18) represent the electromagnetic field and so our thoughts.
But in the end what wins is darkness, peace, and eternity represented by the snake. It symbolizes eternal wisdom and reincarnation, which implies that death has no effect as we keep all of our memories intact.
The lotus flower is a symbol of purity and beauty that holds itself above the mud and water (matter). It is also a symbol of spiritual awakening. 
The lotus stands for victory over the desire for life and represents power over death.
The snake inside the lotus flower signifies becoming victorious over death by escaping rebirth and reincarnation in a timeless empty Universe.

Is this the ultimate purpose of Life?
